meanings.definition: A person who has run away
meanings.sent1: The runagate was found hiding in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The town was abuzz with news of the runagate's escape.
meanings.sent3: The runagate's attempt at hiding behind a small bush was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: In the game of hide-and-seek, the runagate was the master of evasion.
meanings.sent5: The runagate's footprints in the mud revealed the path of escape.

meanings.definition: To run away from a place or situation
meanings.sent1: When the dog saw the mailman approaching, it tried to runagate into the house.
meanings.sent2: The thief decided to runagate when he heard the police sirens approaching.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to runagate up the tree before the cat could catch it.
meanings.sent4: The children's laughter echoed as they played runagate from the imaginary monster.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit's instinct was to runagate at the first sign of danger.

meanings.definition: To behave in a rebellious or lawless manner
meanings.sent1: The students planned to runagate by skipping class and going to the beach.
meanings.sent2: The pirates were known to runagate across the seas, plundering ships along the way.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's decision to runagate by drawing on the walls caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: The outlaws continued to runagate, always staying a step ahead of the law.
meanings.sent5: The rebels' plan was to runagate under the cover of darkness, avoiding detection.
